data.title: Rice University
data.meta_description: April 2, 2007 Washington, DC -- Lon Babby and Jim Tanner of Williams & Connolly LLP announce that Rice University senior guard Morris Almond has selected the...
data.text:
April 2, 2007

Washington, DC -- Lon Babby and Jim Tanner of Williams & Connolly LLP announce that Rice University senior guard Morris Almond has selected the Washington, DC law firm for his representation. The firm will represent Almond in all contractual agreements, personal appearances, corporate partnerships and other business opportunities.

After interviewing five firms, Almond believed that Williams & Connolly best typified what he was searching for in representation.

"Williams & Connolly has a great reputation and their professionalism really appealed to me," commented Almond. "I felt that they were the best fit and I'm looking forward to working with Lon (Babby) and Jim (Tanner) as I further my professional basketball career."

"We are excited by the opportunity to work with Morris," said Babby. "He represents the very best of college basketball." Tanner added "We really look forward to working with Morris and his family. He is poised to have an outstanding professional career both on and off the court."

A native of Powder Springs, Georgia, Almond was the 2006-07 Conference USA Player of the Year and ranked third in the nation in scoring at 26.4 points per game. Additionally, Almond averaged 24.1 points a game in Conference USA games which led all scorers and which ranks second all-time in Conference USA history behind his 25.1 ppg scored last year.

Almond was named to the 2007 National Association of Basketball Coaches First Team (District 9) and to the US Basketball Writers Association All-District VII First Team. A Wooden Award mid-season All-American, Almond is also a finalist for the Naismith Award and the Senior CLASS Award.

He will graduate from Rice on Saturday, May 12 and then prepare for the June 28 NBA Draft.

-------------

WILLIAMS & CONNOLLY LLP's long-standing sports practice is led by partners Lon Babby and Jim Tanner. The practice specializes in the areas of player representation as well as sports controversies, business planning and transactions. Clients of the practice include NBA stars Tim Duncan, Grant Hill, Ray Allen, Shane Battier, Bruce Bowen, Luke Walton, Josh Childress, Marvin Williams and Luke Ridnour; Major League Baseball stars including Melvin Mora, Chris Young, Rickie Weeks, Chris Ray, and Chris Shelton; WNBA standouts including Chamique Holdsclaw, Tamika Catchings, and Alana Beard; and coaches Jim Larranaga and Nikki McCray. The professional athletes W&C represent rely on them to negotiate player and marketing contracts, to structure their business relationships, and to counsel them on all aspects of their professional careers. The firm also focuses on a broad and varying array of legal areas and business issues involving individual athletes, teams, and their owners in a wide variety of sports.
